creditpilot_theme.name: CreditPilot Official Theme
creditpilot_theme.description: Official unified color scheme for CreditPilot - Premium, Sophisticated, High-end. This is the ONLY color configuration file for the entire system.

core_colors.description: Mandatory 3-color palette for ALL Web UI components. NEVER use any other colors for Web UI.

usage.black: Primary background color for all pages
usage.hot_pink: Primary accent, buttons, links, revenue, income, credits, highlights
usage.dark_purple: Secondary accent, borders, expenses, debits, secondary buttons
usage.white: Primary text color on dark backgrounds

status_colors.description: Functional status colors for success/warning/error indicators. These are the ONLY non-core colors allowed in Web UI.

usage.success: Success messages, positive indicators, 'Excellent' risk grade
usage.warning: Warning messages, caution indicators, 'Good/Fair' risk grade
usage.error: Error messages, negative indicators, 'Poor' risk grade

excel_colors.description: Colors exclusively for Excel report formatting. Do NOT use these colors in Web UI.

deprecated_colors.description: These colors are NO LONGER ALLOWED. If you find them in code, replace them immediately.

galaxy_theme.reason: Galaxy Theme has been archived. Use core_colors instead.

monthly_report_old.reason: Old monthly report colors. Use hot_pink #FF007F instead.

loan_system_old.reason: Old loan system gold accent. Use hot_pink #FF007F instead.

button_styles.description: Standard button color combinations using core colors only

gradient_styles.description: Approved gradient combinations using core colors only

mandatory: All Web UI components MUST use only core_colors (black, hot_pink, dark_purple, white)
Status indicators may use status_colors (success, warning, error, info)
Excel reports MUST use only excel_colors
NO hardcoded color values in .py, .css, .html files
ALL color references must load from this config/colors.json file
Any color in deprecated_colors must be replaced immediately
prohibited: Creating new color schemes without approval
